mdRecord.dcterms:title: Regula placitandi: A collection of special rules for pleading, from the declaration to the issue, in actions real, personal, and mixt; with the distinction of words to be used therein, or refused. Also directions for laying of actions, of the time for bringing them, and of the persons to bring the same. Together with some remarks and observations touching averments, notice, request or demand, justifications, innuendo's, protestando, traverse, averment, double pleas, abatements, demurrers, trials, verdicts, judgments, writs of error, estoppels and conclusions. With divers precedents, illustrating and explaining the same
Collection of special rules for pleading
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Pleading--Great Britain
